string-array.name: noNoticeArray
string-array.item: We\'re in the zone, no notifications allowed!
No notifications, just code and caffeine.
We\'re hacking like it\'s 1999, notifications be gone!
Sorry notifications, this is a hackathon, you\'re not invited!
Our focus is on hacking, not on notifications.
Notifications? We\'ve got bigger fish to fry.
Notifications? We\'ve got hacking to do.
Quiet as a library, not a single notification in sight.
All clear, no notifications to see here.
A moment of peace, no notifications to disturb.
A notification-free zone, enjoy the tranquility.
You\'re the chosen one! Find Rishabh to break out of the Matrix. - Morpheus
No buzzing, no beeping, just silence.
The calm before the notification storm.
Notifications? None. Relax and enjoy the silence.
No alerts, no interruptions, just you and your hackathon.
Notifications at bay, focus on coding and creating.
Nothing to see here, move along.
All quiet on the notification front.
No updates, no news, just peace and quiet.
No alerts, no fuss, just chill.
Not a peep from the notification world.
No updates to report, carry on with your day.
Notifications? Not in our hackathon vocabulary.
The hackathon is in session, notifications are adjourned.

resources.string: Pillai HOC College of Engineering and Technology is a leading institution in technology education, offering a state-of-the-art learning environment with modern facilities and experienced faculty. The college is hosting a hackathon in March 2023 and seeking sponsorship from technology companies to provide opportunities for students to showcase their skills and connect with industry leaders. The Department of Computer Engineering at Pillai HOC College of Engineering and Technology emphasizes both technical and ethical education, promoting innovative problem-solving and environmental protection. The department regularly organizes events such as Tech Thrive and Code Fest and encourages students to participate in hackathons, having achieved AIR 1 in the Smart India Hackathon 2022. The college invites companies in the technology industry to join in their efforts to enhance student learning experiences through the upcoming hackathon.

HackOverflow,3-day long National level hackathon organized by the Department of Computer Engineering at PHET, brings together students from all over the country to showcase their skills and creativity in software development. The event provides a platform for collaboration, learning, and the development of new solutions to real-world problems. The hackathon will be held On Our 14-acre campus, where food, accommodation, and all other necessary facilities will be provided for the participants. We will also be providing Goodies, T-shirt and Placement Opportunities with participating companies to all participants. (Job Fair)
